title: Weather and Time in Summoners Rift
body:
Just some ideas,

You'd load into a Summoners Rift game and it would have a randomized weather pattern for each game. 

Sometimes the Rift would be rainy, while another could be snowing or even a perfect day.

Maybe games could start at night and transition to day, and others could start at day and then transition to nightfall.
Summoners Rift can get kind of old after the 300th ranked game. 

There could even be a setting to choose to have that or not before the game starts. 
I believe a system like this would greatly improve the overall enjoyment and quality of the game.

An interesting idea for sure. Riot has already experimented somewhat with rain on the rift. If you jungle in the red team's jungle, you can see that in one area it is raining constantly, although rather lightly.

If they sold stuff like a rainy Summoner's Rift for example, nothing special just some rain drops effects + darker ambient/shadows I would easily buy this, it gets boring seeing the same exact map over and over again and I believe it's psychologically proven that change in scenery can improve your emotional state tremendously. I think people seeing very simple changes like a Sunny, Winter, Rainy, Sandstorm, etc (different seasons, weathers, natural phenomenons) on the Summoner's Rift would make the game less repetitive.

Believe it or not the small things just like adding rain drops in the background or gusts of wind blowing on top of the changes in lighting could make everyone play the game more often in a more enjoyable way. I don't think this would be super easy for Riot to create, but I definitely don't think it would be difficult either. It would make the players more happy whether they realized it or not also.
